html:
Etymology[edit]

From ferōx (“wild, fierce”)

Pronunciation[edit]

  • (Classical) IPA(key): /feˈroː.ki.oː/, [fɛˈɾoː.ki.oː]
  • (Ecclesiastical) IPA(key): /feˈro.t͡ʃi.o/, [fɛˈrɔː.t͡ʃi.ɔ]

Verb[edit]

ferōciō (present infinitive ferōcīre, perfect active ferōcīvī or ferōciī, supine ferōcītum); fourth conjugation

  1. I am fierce, unruly, ungovernable
  2. I rage, I am furious
